https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4wj5OrAlwsg

I'm sorry but I wouldn't consider that video very informative as opposed to a rant loaded with a bunch of statements like tht singed isn't OP,  ADC's are too weak, Singed beats tanky champions and doesn't really spend anytime going into detail why. Hell, his own evidence actually detract from his point when you actually take a moment to think about it at the end of the video. 

Here's my explanation is that the sheer sustain through the dark seal combo gives Singed the early laning power to continually push waves against tanks which prevents them from generating any lane pressure since tanks don't waveclear very quickly. They are constantly being shoved in, proxied, and any kind of trade they make against singed would simply be shrugged off as it's hard to initiate onto singed and keep him locked down even if the jungler shows up. You can generalize to say that Singed wouldn't just work on tanks but any champion without proper waveclear and high mana costs.  Furthermore the bonus healing is extremely cost efficient meaning that Singed can heal an absurd amount with corrupting potion making early tower dives and skirmishes even more feasible. I might agree he isn't OP, but no, he doesn't need a buff. Hell, he's probably the kind of champion who shouldn't even be viable at a competitive level but who knows.

Given that Singed really doesn't cleanly fit into any of the sub classes that Riot had layed out. He doesn't really have enough Hard CC to be a good Vanguard, And he's a bit too mobile to be classified as a Juggernaut. And I think buy and large, he has a very unique kit, that is difficult to maintain a really good team wide niche. 

I also kinda find his build options to be in a weird place, mainly his passive. Realistically his passive should make mana focused tank items really useful, (Frozen Heart, Righteous glory, etc) and yet, due to his lack of CC I feel you can't afford to neglect damage on him. While at the same time, His passive doesn't really make him tanky enough building mainly mana/AP items. (Probably get chastised if I tried building Tear.) 

That in mind, the fact that the pros discovered the hysterical multi dark seal build. suggest to me that Riot isn't likely going to be looking for buffs any time soon.
The fact that he doesn't need changes and still does decent in games proves something
